1: Power your units up on the Mana Board!
2: If you're having trouble with a stage, try using the recommended element.
3: Use dashes and skills to build up your combo and unleash a power flip.
4: You can increase the level of a power flip by raising your combo. The max is Lv. 3!
5: Hit Continue, and your units will resume the battle max HP and full Skill Gauges.
6: The orbs you get from completing story chapters are powerful armaments. Try using them!
7: Equip Ability Cores on the Mana Board.
8: Unleash skills on downed foes to inflict major damage.
9: Raise a unit's level cap to unlock their full potential.
10: The Support Power Flip grants Pierce, which makes it easy to charge soft spots headlong.
11: The Support Power Flip grants Levitate, which means your units ignore all gravity and wind effects.
12: The Bruiser Power Flip inflicts massive damage on a single foe.
13: The Warrior Power Flip has a wide strike range.
14: The Deadeye Power Flip unleashes a deadly beam that travels through obstacles.
15: The Special Power Flip hits a huge chunk of the field with an explosion.
16: Healers are key to surviving drawn out battles.
17: Dead Soul is a homing shot. Instead of trying to dodge, launch your units at the attack and guard instead.
18: The Volt Cavalry is tough, but he's weak to wind damage.
19: Whitetail's guardbeasts get in the way, but if you maneuver above them, you can rack up your combo quickly.
20: Look out for powerful attacks during Whitetail's second phase. Focus on his soft spots!
21: Use dashes wisely to dodge Whitetail's Bitter Annihilation and seize the offensive.
22: Whitetail goes into Blind Fury mode when his HP crosses a certain threshhold. Have your skills ready to go!
23: Let Assault Charge get close, then dodge by escaping to the top of the playfield.
24: Pay attention to how Plasma Shot is timed. Then guard against the attack by launching your units straight into it.
25: Lots of foes means lots of obstacles! Clear them out to make room for your units.
26: rm-rf/ is dangerous. Down the Administrator first, and keep her from ever using the skill.
27: Down Arch Accursed before it can use Gloomy Gale, then unleash a flurry of devastating attacks.
28: The little daemons have a wide strike range. Finish them off first.
29: Arch Accursed is wide open when it uses Malefic Mine. It's your chance to go on the offensive.
30: The head that appears on the right at the beginning of an Orochi fight summons obstacles.
31: The head that appears on the left at the beginning of an Orochi fight can heal the other heads.
32: Orochi's heads appear in the same order every time. Use your experience to plan ahead!
33: Use skills and power flips to target foes' soft spots.
34: Remember, you don't have to flip the flippers. Stay low to avoid Spark Edge.
35: The lightning rods could destroy your entire partyâ€”unless you destroy them first.
36: Skill chains down foes and dole out some major damage.
37: When you and other players use skills in quick succession, you can form a skill chain. It's all about timing.
38: Some heal skills work on other players' units.
